intro: Nephelium hypoleucum, commonly known as the white mangosteen, is a tropical fruit-bearing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is closely related to the common mangosteen (Nephelium lappaceum). The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit, which is typically round and about 3–5 cm in diameter, has a thick, pale pink rind and a sweet, aromatic pulp. The botanical features of Nephelium hypoleucum make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and culinary use.
